verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> when they had traveled <S%G1353><s%> through <S%G1353><s%> Amphipolis <S%G295><s%> and Apollonia, <S%G624><s%> they came <S%G2064><s%> to Thessalonica, <S%G2332><s%> where <S%G3699><s%> there was a synagogue <S%G4864><s%> of the Jews. <S%G2453><s%>

And according <S%G2596><s%> to Paul's custom, <S%G1486><s%> he went <S%G1525><s%> to them, and for three <S%G5140><s%> Sabbaths <S%G4521><s%> reasoned <S%G1256><s%> with them from the Scriptures, <S%G1124><s%>

explaining <S%G1272><s%> and giving <S%G3908><s%> evidence <S%G3908><s%> that the Christ <S%G5547><s%> had <S%G1163><s%> to suffer <S%G3958><s%> and rise <S%G450><s%> again <S%G450><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and [saying,] "This <S%G3778><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I am proclaiming <S%G2605><s%> to you is the Christ. <S%G5547><s%>"

And some <S%G5100><s%> of them were persuaded <S%G3982><s%> and joined <S%G4345><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and Silas, <S%G4609><s%> along <S%G5037><s%> with a great <S%G4183><s%> multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the God-fearing Greeks <S%G1672><s%> and a number <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3641><s%> of the leading <S%G4413><s%> women. <S%G1135><s%>

But the Jews, <S%G2453><s%> becoming <S%G2206><s%> jealous <S%G2206><s%> and taking <S%G4355><s%> along <S%G4355><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> wicked <S%G4190><s%> men <S%G435><s%> from the market <S%G60><s%> place, <S%G60><s%> formed <S%G3792><s%> a mob <S%G3792><s%> and set <S%G2350><s%> the city <S%G4172><s%> in an uproar; <S%G2350><s%> and coming <S%G2186><s%> upon the house <S%G3614><s%> of Jason, <S%G2394><s%> they were seeking <S%G2212><s%> to bring <S%G4254><s%> them out to the people. <S%G1218><s%>

And when they did not find <S%G2147><s%> them, they [began] dragging <S%G4951><s%> Jason <S%G2394><s%> and some <S%G5100><s%> brethren <S%G80><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> the city <S%G4173><s%> authorities, <S%G4173><s%> shouting, <S%G994><s%> "These <S%G3778><s%> men <S%G3778><s%> who have upset <S%G387><s%> the world <S%G3625><s%> have come <S%G3918><s%> here <S%G1759><s%> also; <S%G2532><s%>

and Jason <S%G2394><s%> has welcomed <S%G5264><s%> them, and they all <S%G3956><s%> act <S%G4238><s%> contrary <S%G561><s%> to the decrees <S%G1378><s%> of Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> that there is another <S%G2087><s%> king, <S%G935><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%> "
And they stirred <S%G5015><s%> up the crowd <S%G3793><s%> and the city <S%G4173><s%> authorities <S%G4173><s%> who heard <S%G191><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things. <S%G3778><s%>
And when they had received <S%G2983><s%> a pledge <S%G2425><s%> from Jason <S%G2394><s%> and the others, <S%G3062><s%> they released <S%G630><s%> them.

And the brethren <S%G80><s%> immediately <S%G2112><s%> sent <S%G1599><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> and Silas <S%G4609><s%> away <S%G1599><s%> by night <S%G3571><s%> to Berea; <S%G960><s%> and when they arrived, <S%G3854><s%> they went <S%G549><s%> into the synagogue <S%G4864><s%> of the Jews. <S%G2453><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> were more <S%G2104><s%> noble-minded than those <S%G3588><s%> in Thessalonica, <S%G2332><s%> for they received <S%G1209><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> with great <S%G3956><s%> eagerness, <S%G4288><s%> examining <S%G350><s%> the Scriptures <S%G1124><s%> daily, <S%G2596><s%> <S%G2250><s%> [to see] whether <S%G1487><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> were so. <S%G3779><s%>

Many <S%G4183><s%> of them therefore <S%G3767><s%> believed, <S%G4100><s%> along <S%G2532><s%> with a number <S%G3756><s%> <S%G3641><s%> of prominent <S%G2158><s%> Greek <S%G1674><s%> women <S%G1135><s%> and men. <S%G435><s%>

But when <S%G5613><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> of Thessalonica <S%G2332><s%> found <S%G1097><s%> out that the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> had been proclaimed <S%G2605><s%> by Paul <S%G3972><s%> in Berea <S%G960><s%> also, <S%G2532><s%> they came <S%G2064><s%> there <S%G2546><s%> likewise, <S%G2546><s%> agitating <S%G4531><s%> and stirring <S%G5015><s%> up the crowds. <S%G3793><s%>

And then <S%G5119><s%> immediately <S%G2112><s%> the brethren <S%G80><s%> sent <S%G1821><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> out to go <S%G4198><s%> as far <S%G2193><s%> as the sea; <S%G2281><s%> and Silas <S%G4609><s%> and Timothy <S%G5095><s%> remained <S%G5278><s%> there. <S%G1563><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> those <S%G3588><s%> who conducted <S%G2525><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> brought <S%G71><s%> him as far <S%G2193><s%> as Athens; <S%G116><s%> and receiving <S%G2983><s%> a command <S%G1785><s%> for Silas <S%G4609><s%> and Timothy <S%G5095><s%> to come <S%G2064><s%> to him as soon <S%G5036><s%> as possible, <S%G5035><s%> they departed. <S%G1826><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> while Paul <S%G3972><s%> was waiting <S%G1551><s%> for them at Athens, <S%G116><s%> his spirit <S%G4151><s%> was being provoked <S%G3947><s%> within <S%G1722><s%> him as he was beholding <S%G2334><s%> the city <S%G4172><s%> full <S%G2712><s%> of idols. <S%G2712><s%>

So <S%G3767><s%> he was reasoning <S%G1256><s%> in the synagogue <S%G4864><s%> with the Jews <S%G2453><s%> and the God-fearing [Gentiles,] and in the market <S%G58><s%> place <S%G58><s%> every <S%G3956><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> with those <S%G3588><s%> who happened <S%G3909><s%> to be present. <S%G3909><s%>

And also <S%G2532><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of the Epicurean <S%G1946><s%> and Stoic <S%G4770><s%> philosophers <S%G5386><s%> were conversing <S%G4820><s%> with him. And some <S%G5100><s%> were saying, <S%G3004><s%> "What <S%G5101><s%> would this <S%G3778><s%> idle <S%G4691><s%> babbler <S%G4691><s%> wish <S%G2309><s%> to say <S%G3004><s%>?" Others, <S%G3588><s%> <S%G1161><s%> "He seems <S%G1380><s%> to be a proclaimer <S%G2604><s%> of strange <S%G3581><s%> deities, <S%G1140><s%>" â€“ because <S%G3754><s%> he was preaching <S%G2097><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> and the resurrection. <S%G386><s%>

And they took <S%G1949><s%> him and brought <S%G71><s%> him to the Areopagus, <S%G697><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "May <S%G1410><s%> we know <S%G1097><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> new <S%G2537><s%> teaching <S%G1322><s%> is which you are proclaiming <S%G2980><s%>?

"For you are bringing <S%G1533><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> strange <S%G3579><s%> things <S%G3579><s%> to our ears; <S%G189><s%> we want <S%G1014><s%> to know <S%G1097><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> things <S%G3778><s%> mean. <S%G2309><s%> <S%G1510><s%>"

(Now <S%G1161><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the Athenians <S%G117><s%> and the strangers <S%G3581><s%> visiting <S%G1927><s%> there used to spend <S%G2119><s%> their time <S%G2119><s%> in nothing <S%G3762><s%> other <S%G2087><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> telling <S%G3004><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> hearing <S%G191><s%> something <S%G5100><s%> new. <S%G2537><s%>)

And Paul <S%G3972><s%> stood <S%G2476><s%> in the midst <S%G3319><s%> of the Areopagus <S%G697><s%> and said, <S%G5346><s%> "Men <S%G435><s%> of Athens, <S%G117><s%> I observe <S%G2334><s%> that you are very <S%G7036><s%> religious <S%G7036><s%> in all <S%G3956><s%> respects. <S%G3956><s%>

"For while I was passing <S%G1330><s%> through <S%G1330><s%> and examining <S%G333><s%> the objects <S%G4574><s%> of your worship, <S%G4574><s%> I also <S%G2532><s%> found <S%G2147><s%> an altar <S%G1041><s%> with this <S%G3739><s%> inscription, <S%G1924><s%> 'TO AN UNKNOWN <S%G57><s%> GOD. <S%G2316><s%>' What <S%G3739><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> you worship <S%G2151><s%> in ignorance, <S%G50><s%> this <S%G3778><s%> I proclaim <S%G2605><s%> to you.

"The God <S%G2316><s%> who made <S%G4160><s%> the world <S%G2889><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> things <S%G3956><s%> in it, since He is Lord <S%G2962><s%> of heaven <S%G3772><s%> and earth, <S%G1093><s%> does not dwell <S%G2730><s%> in temples <S%G3485><s%> made <S%G5499><s%> with hands; <S%G5499><s%>

neither <S%G3761><s%> is He served <S%G2323><s%> by human <S%G442><s%> hands, <S%G5495><s%> as though He needed <S%G4326><s%> anything, <S%G5100><s%> since He Himself <S%G846><s%> gives <S%G1325><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> life <S%G2222><s%> and breath <S%G4157><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> things; <S%G3956><s%>

and He made <S%G4160><s%> from one, <S%G1520><s%> every <S%G3956><s%> nation <S%G1484><s%> of mankind <S%G444><s%> to live <S%G2730><s%> on all <S%G3956><s%> the face <S%G4383><s%> of the earth, <S%G1093><s%> having determined <S%G3724><s%> [their] appointed <S%G4367><s%> times, <S%G2540><s%> and the boundaries <S%G3734><s%> of their habitation, <S%G2733><s%>

that they should seek <S%G2212><s%> God, <S%G2316><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> perhaps <S%G686><s%> they might grope <S%G5584><s%> for Him and find <S%G2147><s%> Him, though <S%G2532><s%> <S%G1065><s%> He is not far <S%G3112><s%> from each <S%G1538><s%> one <S%G1520><s%> of us;

for in Him we live <S%G2198><s%> and move <S%G2795><s%> and exist, <S%G1510><s%> as even <S%G2532><s%> some <S%G5100><s%> of your own poets <S%G4163><s%> have said, <S%G3004><s%> 'For we also <S%G2532><s%> are His offspring. <S%G1085><s%>'

"Being <S%G5225><s%> then <S%G3767><s%> the offspring <S%G1085><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> we ought <S%G3784><s%> not to think <S%G3543><s%> that the Divine <S%G2304><s%> Nature <S%G2304><s%> is like <S%G3664><s%> gold <S%G5557><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> silver <S%G696><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> stone, <S%G3037><s%> an image <S%G5480><s%> formed <S%G5480><s%> by the art <S%G5078><s%> and thought <S%G1761><s%> of man. <S%G444><s%>

"Therefore <S%G3767><s%> having overlooked <S%G5237><s%> the times <S%G5550><s%> of ignorance, <S%G52><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> is now <S%G3568><s%> declaring <S%G518><s%> to men <S%G444><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> everywhere <S%G3837><s%> should repent, <S%G3340><s%>

because <S%G2530><s%> He has fixed <S%G2476><s%> a day <S%G2250><s%> in which <S%G3739><s%> He will <S%G3195><s%> judge <S%G2919><s%> the world <S%G3625><s%> in righteousness <S%G1343><s%> through <S%G1722><s%> a Man <S%G435><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> He has appointed, <S%G3724><s%> having furnished <S%G3930><s%> proof <S%G4102><s%> to all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G3956><s%> by raising <S%G450><s%> Him from the dead. <S%G3498><s%> "

Now <S%G1161><s%> when they heard <S%G191><s%> of the resurrection <S%G386><s%> of the dead, <S%G3498><s%> some <S%G3588><s%> <S%G3303><s%> [began] to sneer, <S%G5512><s%> but others <S%G3588><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> "We shall hear <S%G191><s%> you again <S%G2532><s%> <S%G3825><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> this. <S%G3778><s%>"
So <S%G3779><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> went <S%G1831><s%> out of their midst. <S%G3319><s%>

But some <S%G5100><s%> men <S%G435><s%> joined <S%G2853><s%> him and believed, <S%G4100><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> were Dionysius <S%G1354><s%> the Areopagite <S%G698><s%> and a woman <S%G1135><s%> named <S%G3686><s%> Damaris <S%G1152><s%> and others <S%G2087><s%> with them.
